title: "What is the meaning of the term 'Beatrice' in relation to love and Hermeticism?"
first_phrase: In the previous paragraphs, the author talks about love that unites two souls without desires, exceptions, interest, and particularisms. This love is called Beatrice, and it is a spirit that announces the Hermetic, like the dawn announcing the sun. The author suggests invoking it and not pushing it away when it comes. The last 200 words discuss prayer as an act of concrete will fluidification and how to change the quality of what is given to lead to a different outcome. The author also emphasizes the importance of love in an ermetic sense, which is a simple force of enveloping and penetrating relationship. Finally, the author explains how such love is not tied to a particular being but rather a state that one should learn to evoke in oneself.
content: Formulare l'idea, e deside- rarne (3) la realizzazione, è preghiera. Cfr. vol. II, cap. VII: « La Magia delle Statuette ». Per il bene, come per il male, ha detto K., k condizione è l'amore, inteso in senso ermetico, come semplice forza di rapporto avvolgente e di penetrazione.[N. d. U.] 2. Un tale amore cessa di essere necessariamente legato ad un particolare essere. Riteniamo anzi che l'allusione all'amore suaccen- nato fra due persone abbia soprattutto per scopo il far capire, per analogia, di che stato si tratti: uno stato che poi in magia si deve giungere a saper evocare in sé senza appoggiarlo e legarlo a nulla. [N. d. U.] 3.
last_phrase: To conclude, to conceive an idea and desire its realization is a prayer. The key to success lies in changing the quality of what is given, by fluidifying it as a state or a mental image that needs to be evoked without attaching it to anything. This is where the power of imagination comes in, creating a well-defined, detailed picture and aligning consciousness with the thought. By doing so, the will is put to action, allowing love to intervene and create a harmonious state between the imagined idea and consciousness, which ultimately leads to the spontaneous manifestation of hermetic power.
